page.title: 03LITTLEBURY
page.content: The oldest building is "The Gate House" which was built in 1260.The chimneys are Elizabethan and the existing roof was built in 1560.The house's main feature is its raised aisled hall.There is one main farm in Littlebury,Mill Farm.The farmer who owns it grows wheat,barley and oil-seed-rape.The animals he owns are cows and a few sheep. On interviewing some of the people in the village we found that most of them thought the 1 shop in Littlebury quite sufficient,but some of them do their shopping in the nearby towns and cities:Saffron Walden, Cambridge, Bishop's Stortford, Harlow and London. Most of the people who do travel do so by car,train or bus.
